comment: Pretty tough course but he's usually pretty good about breaking down material further if needed. Attendance wasn't mandatory but would take random attendance when class was sparsely populated. If you pay attention and ask questions you should make it through ok.

Good at teaching a difficult topic. Explains the hard topics well. Homework's come from what you've solved in class in lectures or random ones he's created. They are sometime challenging but a good challenge. 2 midterm, take home, you have a 5 days and they are a good challenge too. There was a bonus point on the first exam. 100% would take again
Easy class and very straight forward. If he is available definitely take his class.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Respected--Graded by few things

comment: Cannot express how good this man is. He is an amazing professor and highly recommend him.

I highly recommend Professor Park. Attendance wasn't mandatory but attending the lectures was very helpful to complete the homework. He does a good job of explaining tough material in detail without getting lost in the weeds about it. The textbook isn't mandatory but I found it super helpful for homework and studying for exams.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: Well, there are only two profs I like in ME. Park and Tekes. Park is exceptional in lectures. No exams but several online quizzes. checked the attendance using attendance sheets randomly. I kind of regretting taking him during summer since materials science has a lot of things. Very helpful and open to any questions. Super nice.

- Doesn't cooperate with students.
- Does not reply back to you.
- Everything is online.
- Checks for attendance. Don't know how.
Great!

Professor Park is great at explaining difficult concepts so it's important to attend lectures. Quizzes and tests are based on homework and examples from lectures. He encourages students to go to office hours for help and was open to any questions students had. Take his class if you can!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: Dr. Park is a good professor. He is knowledgeable. I can imagine how hard the tests could be but he makes them reasonable. He goes over examples in class, and gives pretty good lectures as well. There was a lot of homework which was graded for accuracy but if you do it and correct your mistakes then you should be ready for the quizzes/tests.

One of my favorite Professors at KSU. You can tell he is knowledgeable and passionate about ME, which really helps when teaching students. Maybe it was because I already found the course material very interesting, but I definitely give Park some credit for making the class fun and enjoyable.

Dr. Park is an excellent professor for Heat Transfer. It is a very in depth and difficult class. But he does an excellent job of teaching the material. Test and Quiz problems were similar to class examples and homework's. I would take him again.

I like his skills in explaining difficult concepts in a very easy way. Material science is not a math course and it is simply about understanding different materials' properties. funny that someone complained about not having math...

Professor Park isn't for everyone, this is a STEM course and he makes his quizzes and tests all T/F and only focus on the conceptual part. Then whenever he gives us an actual math problem, we have no idea how to solve it. Like I said, if you learn better by only wanting to learn conceptual information, take him.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: Overall a great professor, it's not easy but he actually helps and teaches you! take him if you can.

Dr. Park is one of my favorite professors at KSU! Heat Transfer is not an easy class but I feel like I really learned a lot from him. I would recommend Dr. Park for any class that he teaches. He is very thorough with the lectures, he always answers questions and the tests/quizzes are very close to the homework. Very fair grader too.

Dr. Park is excellent for Materials Science. His passion and knowledge of the subject are apparent. Supremely nice guy. The actual coursework is challenging, but representative of the information that has been taught. Group project instead of final exam. I actually enjoyed it but it was a lot of work. Pick team members carefully. Good luck!

I'm very conflicted in my review, the first part of the semester went great, when professor Park was grading and giving good feed back. Then his TA took over and I little to no feedback. This was annoying because the long answer questions have multiple answers :/ with that said its the only time in my life I have averaged 94 on tests and got a C.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: Mr. Park is a nice guy and he did a good job teaching ME 3101. The group project certainly occupied the majority of my time in this class. But, the Tests were easy. I would recommend him to others.

Personally he is my favorite professor at Kennesaw State. He will answer any question. He gives you everything you need in class and in his online notes in order to be successful in the class. You do need to put in some work, but you will learn a lot.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Good for heat transfer. actually good at online teaching considering this unexpected situation.
Good instructor! Very polite.
One of my favorite professors at KSU
Know yourself before taking. If you are a good student, it could be the best class. However, if you are a person who wants a good grade with the least amount of effort like me, avoid him.
A great teacher. His lecture contains interesting materials all the time. Don't get misled by rmp.

Took Park during Spring 2019, This is not easy class, you will have to put effort into class to get the grade you want. The final research paper will take the most time when you are approaching finals. AVOID HIM AT ALL COST
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Park is great professor, don't let the RMP score scare you away. As long as you study you homework and notes you will pass this class with an easy B.

This class is not easy but anything he expects of you, he fully prepares you for. The homework comes from the lecture and the quizzes and test are the same as the homework, just with different numbers. So if you go to the lecture and do the homework you should be just fine.
Great for HEAT TRANSFER.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: He is one of my few favorite professors in mechanical engineering. Very knowledgeable. Knows his stuff.

I don't agree with all the negative comments. Maybe he changed his lecture style. Actually, I didn't take 3201, so, I am not sure about 3201. However, his materials science was one of the easiest and most interesting classes I have taken. He somehow managed to make the topics to be interesting and easy.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Amazing lectures--Would take again

comment: Very slow talking professor. He reads the power points word for word and the classes become very long because of his monotone voice. There was a substantial  amount of work load for a two credit class. Group project was very time consuming without actually learning anything significant.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Gave us a take home Midterm which takes 7-8 hours to complete. The Midterm has to be completely handwritten as well. Two projects throughout the semester. If you can be a Group leader for the second project do it because if you aren't the group leader you will not get an A in his class. Even with A's on every assignment only group leaders get A's.

Product Realization is only a 2 credit hour class. This semester he decided to give us a take home mid-term you would think was an easy pass, but the midterm took an average of 7 hours to do with. He wanted each question hand written only and he graded off of appearance and grammar as well as accuracy. Id recommend someone else for this class.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Don't take him. His lectures are incredibly boring, just skips through slides. He gives tough homework problems on concepts he doesn't even cover in class. Some of the concepts aren't even in the course textbook. Worst professor in ME department I've ever had.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK
